Title: Houston, we have a triangle
Author: Devin Kelly-Collins
Content:
So much for the once a week update. I would like to say that updates from here on out will be more frequent and consistent but to be honest I don't trust myself that much at this point.

The good news is that development of nemesis has started in earnest. If you checkout the repo right now the sample game should be able to draw a triangle. Not much, I know.

Much of my time up till this point has been finding and learning a good framework to facilitate good design. I settled on using requirejs, which if you have not looked at, you should. I am using requirejs because it does seem to offer the best of both worlds solution. Developers can write their javascript in a modular fashion, bringing all the benefits that it provides. Then, using requirejs' optimizer, code can be served in a single file.

Another awesome thing about requirejs is their plugins. One that I am using is text which allows you to require text files. This, along with the json plugin, provides quite the range of flexibility.
